author: NonoBadDog
title: Fox News most-trusted TV news/commentary source: poll
text: Bias in the Media Fox News most-trusted TV news/commentary source: poll This is a political forum that is non-biased/non-partisan and treats every persons position on topics equally. This debate forum is not aligned to any political party. In today's politics , many ideas are split between and even within all the political parties. Often we find ourselves agreeing on one platform but some topics break our mold. We are here to discuss them in a civil political debate. If this is your first visit to our political forums, be sure to check out the FAQ and RULES . Registering for debate politics is necessary before posting. Register today to participate and remove the ads - it's free! Results 1 to 6 of 6 Fox News most-trusted TV news/commentary source: poll - Washington Times Nearly a quarter of U.S. voters say Fox News is the television news or commentary source they trust the most, putting the network ahead of its cable news and network rivals on that front. Twenty-three percent of voters named Fox News as the TV news or commentary source they trust the most, according to a Suffolk University/USA TODAY poll released Wednesday. CNN was second at 15 percent, followed by NBC at 10 percent and CBS at 9 percent. ABC was at 6 percent, followed by MSNBC at 5 percent, Comedy Central at 4 percent , and C-SPAN at 3 percent. About a quarter were undecided. The survey of 1,000 likely voters was conducted Sept. 24-28 and has a margin of error of plus or minus 3 percentage points . Really, Comedy Central? MSNBC almost got beat out by Comedy Central and was within the margin of error. Originally Posted by Soho gator Are there some who hate ALL white people? Sure. Are they racists? No. Originally Posted by Absentglare Give me a break. Your case is a bunch of weak speculation which is why Hillary will likely get off just like her husband . Zing! Re: Fox News most-trusted TV news/commentary source: poll Reads to me as... Jokesters (CC and CSPAN): 7% Skeptics (undecided): 23% Pretty much what I'd expect from any poll. Oh, wait... are we supposed to pretend this is a reflection of a network's integrity and not just a reflection of America's political demographics? Last edited by ecofarm; Today at 12:48 AM . Re: Fox News most-trusted TV news/commentary source: poll Originally Posted by NonoBadDog Fox News most-trusted TV news/commentary source: poll - Washington Times Nearly a quarter of U.S. voters say Fox News is the television news or commentary source they trust the most, putting the network ahead of its cable news and network rivals on that front. Twenty-three percent of voters named Fox News as the TV news or commentary source they trust the most, according to a Suffolk University/USA TODAY poll released Wednesday. CNN was second at 15 percent, followed by NBC at 10 percent and CBS at 9 percent. ABC was at 6 percent, followed by MSNBC at 5 percent, Comedy Central at 4 percent , and C-SPAN at 3 percent. About a quarter were undecided. The survey of 1,000 likely voters was conducted Sept. 24-28 and has a margin of error of plus or minus 3 percentage points . Really, Comedy Central? MSNBC almost got beat out by Comedy Central and was within the margin of error. Fox being most trusted at 23% means fox is the least trusted at 77% Correct The Record is a strategic research and rapid response team designed to defend Hillary Clinton from baseless attacks. As you are, I was. Join Date on an island off the left coast of Canada Last Seen Re: Fox News most-trusted TV news/commentary source: poll Originally Posted by NonoBadDog Fox News most-trusted TV news/commentary source: poll - Washington Times Nearly a quarter of U.S. voters say Fox News is the television news or commentary source they trust the most, putting the network ahead of its cable news and network rivals on that front. Twenty-three percent of voters named Fox News as the TV news or commentary source they trust the most, according to a Suffolk University/USA TODAY poll released Wednesday. CNN was second at 15 percent, followed by NBC at 10 percent and CBS at 9 percent. ABC was at 6 percent, followed by MSNBC at 5 percent, Comedy Central at 4 percent , and C-SPAN at 3 percent. About a quarter were undecided. The survey of 1,000 likely voters was conducted Sept. 24-28 and has a margin of error of plus or minus 3 percentage points . Really, Comedy Central? MSNBC almost got beat out by Comedy Central and was within the margin of error. I never watch it anymore. Is that Glenn Beck clown still there with his blackboard and arrows? Or that Ann Coulter tranny? And CNN pisses me off every time they use some'breaking news' non-event to pre-empt Anthony Bourdain. You can't be first but you could be next.
